posts.name: Anna
posts.cooked: My FRC team wants to make practice bumpers only for practice matches. We want to decorate it with our team logo and other things. We were wondering if the practice bumpers must include the team number anywhere on the bumper since we plan on not including them.

posts.name: BBaltrusch
posts.cooked: I‚Äôd like to remind everyone that practice matches are practice for the refs too, please don‚Äôt deliberately make things harder for them.  Why wouldn‚Äôt you put your numbers on?  Lots of teams scout during practice too.

posts.name: Anna
posts.cooked: Our numbers will still be on it, but they will be much smaller. We don‚Äôt want to add numbers for the purpose of having more space to add our team logo and motto.

posts.name: Gus Michel II
posts.cooked: Robonauts did several practice matches at Magnolia with their golden ‚ÄúEcho‚Äù bumpers.  Your experience may vary.  I would suggest consulting the head referee and FTA at your event.

posts.name: Ryan Stockton
posts.cooked:
We regularly run practice matches with our show bumpers. These are usually white with gold ‚Äú118‚Äù and ‚ÄúRobonauts‚Äù embroidered on like below. 1182023 1920√ó1440 157 KB This year we are running plain white sailcloth bumpers in practice matches with no numbers. We have never had any issues doing so but if we were asked by the head ref to change to our competition bumpers we would.

1182023 1920√ó1440 157 KB

1182023 1920√ó1440 157 KB

posts.name: NathanNFM
posts.cooked: I always recommend using competition bumpers in practice matches, especially this year with the charge station. The friction dynamic between your bumpers and the field elements, game pieces, and other robots is something you are going to want to figure out during practice, and if you use different materials on your show bumpers they may behave differently.

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked:
We ran one set all practice and first couple matches, then when we switched we realized that one side had been installed upside down on the other color set.  Luckily it was stick on numbers this year, so we were able to fix it.

But it may be useful to use both colors in practice at least once to be sure there isn‚Äôt any undiscovered issues to be fixed.
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Nick Coussens
posts.cooked: We have black practice bumpers that is the exact same material as our red and black. They do not have numbers on them. We do this simply so the red and blue sets get less beat up over the course of the season. Typically field staff do not have a problem with it, but like Ryan said, we would simply switch to red or blue if a red or someone has a serious issue with it. You definitely can just run red or blue all day without changing based on alliance color.

This is what we do too. Black cordura bumpers, same noodles as competition bumpers.

We use them as show/practice bumpers without issue. Last year was the first time we really had an issue with not having full numbers (we have just the white outline), because of the way the ball behaved against the vinyl vs fabric.

posts.name: MrRoboSteve
posts.cooked: More than one robot in a practice match without numbers is very confusing for field staff.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
